chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber M. Chartier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $518 - payment to be taken from bond on deposit with any remaining balance to be returned to poster.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription. 
No THC in any form.
No entry into any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications as prescribed for Mental Health or Substance Abuse.
May only take vivitrol - may not take methadone or suboxone.
AODA and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 11-29-2022.

ADA heard - no corrections to PSI.
ADA heard on sentencing recommendation.
Atty Spansail heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1:
2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, and places Deft on probation for 3 years. 
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
3 months conditional jail, without good time, but with huber release for treatment or employment purposes.
Credit for 62 days time served.
Deft to report to the Marinette County Jail no later than 7pm on November 29, 2022.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $518.00 - payment to be taken from bond on deposit, with any remaining balance to be returned to bond poster.
